name: The New London Carlton Hotel

reviews.text: I booked this with some trepidation because of the negative reviews - but clearly it has been refurbished and upgraded.
reviews.title: Good Quality room in good location at reasonable price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is clearly a mixture of self contained apartments and more traditional hotel rooms - but the quality and finish of my room was very good.
reviews.title: good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is smart and clean and 5 mins from Maida Vale tube which got me into Oxford circus in 10 mins.
reviews.title: great place to stay-good value

reviews.text: Best of all the hotel offers onsite parking for £10 a day - which actually seems comparable. Overall the price (although objectively high) is still reasonable for London and compares well with the large chain hotel 200 yards up the road !
reviews.title: Perfect!

reviews.text: Overall I would recommend ignoring the older reviews and give it a go
reviews.title: A great find!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had room 25 situated at the back of the hotel, good sized room and away from the main road, very quiet. The hotel was good value for money and in a location close to the Under/Overground stations.
reviews.title: Nice Place to Stay

reviews.text: Also not too far away is a great little Bistro "The Elgin", and Little Venice is within walking distance.
reviews.title: Good place for a short stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ideal place for a short stay. Stayed overnight. Good value for London with the added bonus of car parking. The apartment had a large bedroom with a small kitchenette and a reasonable toilet and shower room.The decor was simple but impressive.The hotel is within easy walking distance to Maida Vale shops and St Johns Wood.They no longer supply breakfast but cafes are close by in Maida Vale. We were informed so took our own continental breakfast.
reviews.title: Nice for a few days away

reviews.text: This is not a five star hotel but for its situation,cleanliness and its cost it is ideal. It would definitely be worth a return visit when visiting London again.
reviews.title: Excellent value for money

reviews.text: Me and my partner were staying here for 3 nights on a trip to London, and managed to get a good deal on laterooms.com, which was the main reason for choosing this particular hotel. The room was a decent size, with enough space in the kitchenette and bathroom too. Lots of storage, wardrobe and drawers if you were staying longer then we were, however bring your own hangers. Only a 5 minute walk to either Kilburn Park or Maida Vale (both Bakerloo line tube) so easy to get around. TV and wi-fi in the room too, and staff were always very friendly.
reviews.title: Very nice

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel in January this year and it wasn't the best place to stay but I was re booked in by my work place as we had a meeting near by. To be honest I pleasantly surprised, upon arrival you could see the changes from the entrance. I was given the room 23 which is at the second floor , when I entered the room was newly painted and it looked spacious, elegantly decorated with quality furniture and flat screen tv. I received cleaning daily, and the staff was very friendly and helpful. I definitely will stay there again.
reviews.title: The New is Better

reviews.text: Excellent Value
reviews.title: New Look , Comfort , Hospitality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Was very pleasantly surprised with my second stay at this hotel.I had booked a double room and I ended up in a luxury double room with fully equiped kitchenette.A lot of space in the room with brand new furniture and appliances.Free wifi with a better connectivity.Not too long for a walk to Maida Vale tube station and a very close bus station towards Marble Arch.Would definitely recommend and will come back again!
reviews.title: Undergoing renovation - might get better

reviews.text: We stayed at the Carlton in Maida Vale for one night during the Olympics. Free parking was a bonus and the staff were friendly and helpful, but that's where the positives finish. The room was OK, but very basic. No bedside lamps, there was a phone, but it was not functional, so when we needed to phone reception to ask how we were supposed to shower in cold water, we had to use our mobile to call the hotel! After asking for hot water, they said they would investigate and that we shoud run it for 5 minutes. After running the shower for about 10 minutes, hot water finally arrived. Our double room had no kitchenette so we can't comment on the self-catering aspect. Their kitchen was not finished, so breakfast was by way of a voucher that we could use at a local cafe. We had no fan or air conditioning in the room, so it was pretty damned hot during the day and we had to sleep with the window open. On the whole, we felt that the hotel had potential and was well located, but just not ready for customers at that time.
reviews.title: Not the best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wouldnt stay here again but had no choice to to lack of availability for hotels during the London 2012 Olympics. Bad points: Sofa bed for kids really uncomfortable and springy! Shower way too small, noisy reception as apartment next to them on the ground floor. NOT a hotel at all just rented apartments as there is no room service, no maid service. Good points: easily accessible from M1, can park car for little expense in safe rear car park. Ten mins from Tube (Maida Vale), direct buses to Marble Arch very frequently. Staff friendly and reception area clean. Our apartment was clean but little whiff from sink every now and then! Won't stay again. Olympics were fab tho so nothing could ruin our three days!!!
reviews.title: long stay 2011

reviews.text: And we could not have picked a better Hotel. Staff were really friendly, the Apartment, at the back of the Hotel, ground floor everything we needed and more. Spotlessly clean, Clean good quality towels daily, Comfortable beds, Self contained kitchen. 15 minute walk to the Tube, 2 stops from Paddington Station. On our final day, the Manager looked after all our luggage until 4.30pm so we could enjoy the glorious sunshine and go shopping.
reviews.title: Weekend away for a 'Tasteful' Hen Do....

reviews.text: Fantastic. Would recommend to all ages.
reviews.title: not swanky but very acceptable for a budget hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stay a lot in really nice 4 star hotels etc with work and stuff but needed a very last minute room (day before) for after a show (had originally planned on coming back) and aboslutely nothing was available that didnt look a total £50 a night fleapit or £250 plus for some very modest places that normally I would pay £110 a night for. This was the one exception that popped up.
reviews.title: not bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It isnt flash and isnt the best looking hotel but in a reasonably pleasant leafy area. It doesnt have a nice reception or bar etc, just really rooms--- but the rooms were very clean indeed, pretty ok furnished, everything worked, bed was perfectly comfortable and nice bedding and the overall decor was quite nice too and tasteful. Clean little kitchen with fridge ,decent bed, couple of armchairs, ironing board and iron, decent shower-all very acceptable in the budget range. Ive stayed in worse 4 stars if just the room was taken into account. We had room 31. the staff were also very pleasant. A decent little budget find.
reviews.title: What a pity!

reviews.text: the room was very clean it had a kitchen and a small bathroom the bed seemed to be at an angle it was very noise not good double glazing the traffic was not good breakfast was good little more than I would pay but it was a special weekend
reviews.title: An overall pleasant stay

aka: The New London Carlton Hotel England
description: The New London Carlton Hotel is a luxury apartahotel located in the heart of central London, providing corporate and individual visitors with a more spacious and carefree alternative to Hotels. The apartments offer a relaxed residence, a home away from home, but with all the facilities of a hotel. The New London Carlton Hotel is located close to the open spaces of Regents Park and Hyde Park as well as the shopping and entertainment facilities of the West End.
